website_summaries.verdict: A more affordable option for a pro controller for the Switch if you're looking to swap out the Joy-Cons.
pros: Connects easily to the Switch via Bluetooth and has a good shock effect when playing
Comes with a 2.6-foot USB cable for charging and controller can be played up to 4 hours straight when fully charged
cons: Too big for young kids and does not include amiibo support

customer_reviews.title: A great alternative to the switch pro controller
customer_reviews.text: So far this is a great controller. I was able to get it hooked up to my Switch without much issue. It paired and says paired as well. The only thing I don’t think it has is rumble. Still worth the price if you want to hold a full size controller.
customer_reviews.author: Scruffy Says I'm On Break

customer_reviews.title: Good with one caveat
customer_reviews.text: The controller seems to work well with the Switch. The only thing I would mention is that the right stick is above the buttons which is opposite of most video game controllers. So, if you are used to Xbox, Playstation, and PC controllers with the right stick below the buttons then it will take a bit of an adjustment. I was playing NBA 2K and it was very strange having to go up from the buttons to the stick or down from the stick to the buttons. My muscle memory wanted to do the exact opposite. Still, the controller seems to function well.
customer_reviews.author: Piano Man

customer_reviews.title: Took a While to Pair
customer_reviews.text: For some reason, this controller wouldn't pair out of the box for me. I had a heart attack getting it to work, and the cable it came with didn't seem to do much. Then I used my phone's USB charger to plug the controller into the Switch and viola! It works perfectly. If you have any trouble setting it up, try plugging it in with a separate cable for the initial pair. After that, wireless works like a charm. Otherwise, it's a very good controller with surprisingly nice haptic feedback for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Raven

customer_reviews.title: 2 weeks and broken already...
customer_reviews.text: Only had for 2 weeks with about 10hrs of total use playing Legend of Zelda by the kids and the left joystick “drifts”. I went to the calibration settings and it clearly shows the joystick doesn’t always return back to the true center, it’s just slightly off but that’s enough to keep Link drifting off ledges and etc. can’t really play a game like that.
customer_reviews.author: Tojam

customer_reviews.title: Best controller for the switch!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I used to play Fortnite on Xbox and now I play on Nintendo Switch. I hate using the joycons so I was looki g for a controller simular to a xbox controller. This is the best controller for Nintendo switch I have found, hands down. I love it and highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Guadz

customer_reviews.title: Like it better than the joy cons
customer_reviews.text: I like this a little better than the double joy cons. This works a little better with my size of hands and I like the right joy stick being above the buttons. Makes using the right joy stick way easier. However, it does make for switching between different controllers a little confusing. I also like the joy sticks on this better than the Power A wired pro controller because this one has some grip on the top where the Power A one is a little slippery. Definitely recommend this controller as a cheaper option for a pro controller.
customer_reviews.author: Peter and Sheri

customer_reviews.title: Read instructions to sync
customer_reviews.text: I just recently bought two different switch controllers both are 3rd party. I like both but this is slightly better due to the grips on the sides. Over it's a great for a 3rd party would definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Fields

customer_reviews.title: HOME + Y to power on. Totally different from Nintendo Pro controller.
customer_reviews.text: The analog stick is in a different spot, so you must retrain yourself to reach the buttons in new places. Gyros work just like the genuine article, and it survived a few throws across the room by my kid. Connect it by plugging it into the charger and pressing HOME + Y. It connects easily and reliably, but cannot power on the Nintendo Switch (I think). Great for big hands, but hard for my 3 year old to reach the buttons. If you're a grown man who prefer custom gear, this just might fit your preferences.
customer_reviews.author: Mechanic

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work
customer_reviews.text: Although the build of this controller was similar to the official Nintendo Pro Controller for the Switch, I was not able to get it to work with my Switch at all. I followed all the proper steps to get it linked and it just would not link to the console. Rather than going through a few returns/attempts with new ones, I just returned it and went for the official controller.
customer_reviews.author: Davewise

customer_reviews.title: Great controller for amazing price
customer_reviews.text: I actually haven’t played on this controller much. I got it so my dad and I could play together. It fits his hands much better than the joy-cons (even when attached together). To me it feels a bit weird because of the position of the joy sticks. I keep reaching for the buttons in the wrong place and understand how my dad keeps clicking A instead of B. I’m sure we’ll get used to it the more we play on it though, just don’t go challenging anyone on a game until you’ve used it a few times
customer_reviews.author: MusicMarcher

customer_reviews.title: Good controller.  Good price.
customer_reviews.text: I initially had issues with this controller. However I realized that it was due to the positioning of my console and not the controller itself. After correcting the issue I was able to use it for several hours without any problems. Setup wasn't as simple as I thought it should be, but I'm not sure if that's a controller issue or the console. Once it was set up and my switch was positioned so the TV wasn't blocking the signal it worked flawlessly.
customer_reviews.author: B. Devero

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good but a few downsides
customer_reviews.text: The controller is great for playing Smash, but one thing to know is that the HD rumble built in is REALLY loud! Also, the rumble is only in the left side of the controller. Other downsides: it uses micro USB and not USB C and there's no way to turn it off without going into the console's controller settings.
customer_reviews.author: spicymomma

customer_reviews.title: Vibration is terrible - intolerable, actually
customer_reviews.text: First of all, it's micro-usb, not usb-c. Not a huge deal, but no chance that it will fit in any controller chargers that fit the Pro Controller. Second, the pairing process is iffy. Pressing home + Y is supposed to pair it, but you have to do it several times before it works. Then there's the killer problem: the vibration. It's awful. It's like an annoying buzzing that numbs your palms rather than a normal controller vibration. It's just totally unusable. Feels very cheap. Very sorry I bought it.
customer_reviews.author: K. Carlson

customer_reviews.title: Not bad remote for the money
customer_reviews.text: I've had issues with buttons sticking but seller stood behind product and sent me a new one. Overall not a bad remote for the money. I like the stick placement on these as my thumb usually inadvertently hits the right stick when going for a B. This one doesn't have that problem.
customer_reviews.author: Voopali

customer_reviews.title: Good customer service.
customer_reviews.text: This is junk. As soon as the return period was up it broke and is no longer usable. Just flashes 2 blue lights and will not do anything else. UPDATE: Seller has worked with us to get a new controller. When it was shipped to our old address and not forwarded they sent a new one directly to our new home. We've had it about a week and it's been used 2-3 times. So far so good. They've had very good customer service.
customer_reviews.author: Adriane Overholser

customer_reviews.title: Dont buy, False advertisement
customer_reviews.text: Doesnt connect to a Nintendo switch without a third party device, this product is complete trash compared to the Real Nintendo controllers. (The real ones also require third party device to work on the Nintendo switch) Also the joysticks feel like they are in a square when normally it should feel like there in a circle or at least an octagon.

customer_reviews.title: Great controller if all buttons worked

The only problem with this controller was that the top left shoulder button did not work. I am in the process of returning it. Edit: The sellers contacted me and offered a full refund or replacement. I chose a refund. Review changed from 2 star to 4 star for them rectifying the situation.

customer_reviews.title: Everything works

More importantly it stayed paired and I didn't have to do it everytime The rumbles are quite decent with respect to feedback. The buttons could have been of better quality but I guess it's fair for the price. I wish the charging cable was the same as that of the pro controller. Have to use 2 different cables for now

customer_reviews.title: Easy to pair and use
